intro: Calycadenia harrisii, commonly known as Harris's goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, linear leaves. It produces small, spiny seed pods that release seeds when disturbed. Calycadenia harrisii is adapted to arid environments and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral ecosystems.
